def triangle_area(a, b, c):
    '''
    Given the lengths of the three sides of a triangle. Return the area of
    the triangle rounded to 2 decimal points if the three sides form a valid triangle. 
    Otherwise return -1
    Three sides make a valid triangle when the sum of any two sides is greater 
    than the third side.
    Example:
    triangle_area(3, 4, 5) == 6.00
    triangle_area(1, 2, 10) == -1
    '''
    if a + b + c > 0:
        return (a * b * c) / (a + b + c)
    else:
        return -1

def triangle_area(a, b, c):
    '''
    Given the lengths of the three sides of a triangle. Return the area of

    '''
    if a + b + c > 0:
        return (a * b * c) / (a + b + c)
    else:
        return -1

def triangle_area(a, b, c):
    '''
    Given the lengths of the three sides of a triangle. Return the area of
    the triangle rounded to 2 decimal points if the three sides form a valid triangle. 
    Otherwise return -1
    Three sides make a valid triangle when the sum of any two sides is greater 
    than the third side.
    Example:
    triangle_area(3, 4, 5) == 6.00
    triangle_area(1, 2, 10) == -1
    '''
    if (a + b + c) > 0:

    else:

def triangle_area(a, b, c):
    '''
    Given the lengths of the three sides of a triangle. Return the area of
    the triangle rounded to 2 decimal points if the three sides form a valid triangle. 
    Otherwise return -1
    Three sides make a valid triangle when the sum of any two sides is greater 
    than the third side.
    Example:
    triangle_area(3, 4, 5) == 6.00
    triangle_area(1, 2, 10) == -1
    '''
    if a + b + c < 0:
        return -1
    if a + b > c:
        return (a + b) * (b + c) / 2
    if a > b:
        return (a + b) * (c + a) / 2
    return (c + a) * (b + c) / 2

def triangle_area(a, b, c):
    '''
    Given the lengths of the three sides of a triangle. Return the area of
    the triangle rounded to 2 decimal points if the three sides form a valid triangle. 
    Otherwise return -1
    Three sides make a valid triangle when the sum of any two sides is greater 
    than the third side.
    Example:
    triangle_area(3, 4, 5) == 6.00
    triangle_area(1, 2, 10) == -1
    '''

    if a == 0:
        return 0
    if b == 0:
        return a * c
    if c == 0:
        return a * b
    return a * b * c

def triangle_area(a, b, c):
    '''
    Given the lengths of the three sides of a triangle. Return the area of
    the triangle rounded to 2 decimal points if the three sides form a valid triangle. 
    Otherwise return -1
    Three sides make a valid triangle when the sum of any two sides is greater 
    than the third side.
    Example:
    triangle_area(3, 4, 5) == 6.00
    triangle_area(1, 2, 10) == -1
    '''
    if a + b + c == 0:
        return -1
    if a > b and a > c:
        return (a + b) * (b + c) / 2
    elif b > a and b > c:
        return (b + c) * (a + c) / 2
    elif c > a and c > b:
        return (c + a) * (a + b) / 2
    else:
        return -1

def triangle_area(a, b, c):

    the triangle rounded to 2 decimal points if the three sides form a valid triangle.

    than the third side.

    triangle_area(3, 4, 5) == 6.00
    triangle_area(1, 2, 10) == -1
    '''
    if a + b + c < 0:
        return -1
    if a > b:
        a, b = b, a
    if a > c:
        a, c = c, a
    if b > c:
        b, c = c, b
    return a * b * c

        return -1

        return -1
    if a + c < 0:
        return -1
    if b + c < 0:
        return -1
    if a * b + b * c + c * a < 0:
        return -1
    return a * b * c - a * b - a * c - b * c - b * a - c * a

def triangle_area(a, b, c):
    '''
    Given the lengths of the three sides of a triangle. Return the area of
    the triangle rounded to 2 decimal points if the three sides form a valid triangle. 
    Otherwise return -1
    Three sides make a valid triangle when the sum of any two sides is greater 
    than the third side.
    Example:
    triangle_area(3, 4, 5) == 6.00
    triangle_area(1, 2, 10) == -1
    '''
    if (a + b + c) > 0:
        return (a * b * c) / (a + b + c)
    else:
        return -1

def triangle_area(a, b, c):
    '''

    '''
    if a + b + c > 0:
        return (a * b * c) / (a + b + c)
    else:
        return -1

def triangle_area(a, b, c):
    '''
    Given the lengths of the three sides of a triangle. Return the area of
    the triangle rounded to 2 decimal points if the three sides form a valid triangle. 
    Otherwise return -1
    Three sides make a valid triangle when the sum of any two sides is greater 
    than the third side.
    Example:
    triangle_area(3, 4, 5) == 6.00

def triangle_area(a, b, c):
    '''
    Given the lengths of the three sides of a triangle. Return the area of
    the triangle rounded to 2 decimal points if the three sides form a valid triangle. 
    Otherwise return -1
    Three sides make a valid triangle when the sum of any two sides is greater 
    than the third side.
    Example:
    triangle_area(3, 4, 5) == 6.00
    triangle_area(1, 2, 10) == -1
    '''
    if a + b + c == 0:
        return -1
    if a > b and a > c:
        return (b + c) * 0.5
    if b > a and b > c:
        return (a + c) * 0.5
    if a > b and b > c:
        return (a + c) * 0.5
    return (b + c) * 0.5

def triangle_area(a, b, c):
    '''
    Given the lengths of the three sides of a triangle. Return the area of
    the triangle rounded to 2 decimal points if the three sides form a valid triangle. 
    Otherwise return -1
    Three sides make a valid triangle when the sum of any two sides is greater 
    than the third side.
    Example:
    triangle_area(3, 4, 5) == 6.00
    triangle_area(1, 2, 10) == -1
    '''
    if a + b + c < 0:
        return -1
    if a + b < 0:
        return -1
    if a + c < 0:
        return -1
    if b + c < 0:
        return -1
    if a * b + b * c + c * a < 0:
        return -1
    return a * b * c - a * b - b * c - c * a

def triangle_area(a, b, c):
    '''
    Given the lengths of the three sides of a triangle. Return the area of
    the triangle rounded to 2 decimal points if the three sides form a valid triangle. 
    Otherwise return -1
    Three sides make a valid triangle when the sum of any two sides is greater 
    than the third side.
    Example:
    triangle_area(3, 4, 5) == 6.00
    triangle_area(1, 2, 10) == -1
    '''
    if a + b + c < 0:
        return -1
    if a == b == c == 0:
        return 0
    return a * b * c / (a + b + c)

def triangle_area(a, b, c):
    '''
    Given the lengths of the three sides of a triangle. Return the area of
    the triangle rounded to 2 decimal points if the three sides form a valid triangle. 
    Otherwise return -1
    Three sides make a valid triangle when the sum of any two sides is greater 
    than the third side.
    Example:
    triangle_area(3, 4, 5) == 6.00
    triangle_area(1, 2, 10) == -1
    '''
    if a + b + c == 0:
        return -1
    if a > b and a > c:
        return (a + b) * (b + c) / 2
    elif b > a and b > c:
        return (a + b) * (c + b) / 2
    elif c > a and c > b:
        return (a + b) * (c + a) / 2
    else:
        return -1

    than the third side.
    Example:
    triangle_area(3, 4, 5) == 6.00
    triangle_area(1, 2, 10) == -1
    '''
    if a + b + c > 0:
        return (a * b * c) / (a + b + c)
    else:
        return -1

def triangle_area(a, b, c):
    '''
    Given the lengths of the three sides of a triangle. Return the area of
    the triangle rounded to 2 decimal points if the three sides form a valid triangle. 
    Otherwise return -1
    Three sides make a valid triangle when the sum of any two sides is greater 
    than the third side.
    Example:
    triangle_area(3, 4, 5) == 6.00
    triangle_area(1, 2, 10) == -1

    if a + b + c > 0:

def triangle_area(a, b, c):
    '''
    Given the lengths of the three sides of a triangle. Return the area of
    the triangle rounded to 2 decimal points if the three sides form a valid triangle. 
    Otherwise return -1
    Three sides make a valid triangle when the sum of any two sides is greater 
    than the third side.
    Example:
    triangle_area(3, 4, 5) == 6.00
    triangle_area(1, 2, 10) == -1
    '''
    if a + b + c < 0:
        return -1
    if a + b < 0:
        return -1
    if a + c < 0:
        return -1
    if b + c < 0:
        return -1
    if a * b + b * c + c * a < 0:
        return -1
    return a * b * c - a * c * b - b * c * a
